macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: S&P/TSX Composite Index Surges 1.7% to 33,023 on Metals and Tech Rally
items.summary: The Canadian benchmark jumped 552 points, extending two-day gains to 3.2%, driven by surging metals prices, tech recovery, and gains in materials and financial stocks. Top performers included IAMGOLD, Orla Mining, and Alamos Gold, each up over 8%.

items.title: Dow Jones Holds Above 50,000 Amid Profit-Taking Ahead of Key US Jobs Data
items.summary: US markets saw muted sessions with Dow maintaining strength above 50,000, while Nasdaq and S&P 500 trimmed gains; traders position cautiously for tomorrow's Non-Farm Payrolls expected below 100K. Metals stayed range-bound after recent lows.

items.title: Vizsla Silver Plunges 12% After Tragic Employee Deaths in Mexico
items.summary: Shares of Vizsla Silver dropped sharply following confirmation that several employees taken from its Mexican project site were found deceased, raising concerns over security and operations.

items.title: Air Canada Shares Fall 4.5% on Suspension of Cuba Flights Due to Fuel Shortage
items.summary: Air Canada slipped after announcing suspension of all services to Cuba amid an ongoing aviation fuel shortage on the island.

items.title: Major Insurers Report Strong Q4 2025 Earnings: Assurant and AIG
items.summary: Assurant and AIG posted robust fourth-quarter and full-year 2025 results, highlighting strength in housing, device-protection, and overall insurance sectors.

items.title: Edwards Lifesciences and Mirion Release Positive Q4 Results with 2026 Guidance
items.summary: Edwards Lifesciences reported strong cardiac device performance signaling medtech recovery, while Mirion provided upbeat full-year 2026 guidance for nuclear and medical markets.

items.title: Nasdaq Launches New Private Capital Indexes for Institutional Investors
items.summary: Nasdaq introduced private capital indexes to enhance benchmarking tools for institutional exposure to private markets.

items.title: Toast and Instacart Announce Strategic Partnership for Restaurant Delivery
items.summary: Toast partnered with Instacart to integrate commerce and delivery services, potentially boosting SaaS and take-rate revenues for restaurants and retailers.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: 01 Quantum and qLABS Launch $qONE Token on HyperEVM After Successful TGE
items.summary: 01 Quantum Inc. and qLABS announced the successful Token Generation Event for $qONE on HyperEVM, now live trading on Hyperliquid DEX, marking Phase 1 of their quantum-resistant blockchain security protocol.[1]

items.title: Morgan Stanley Initiates Coverage on Bitcoin Miners as AI Infrastructure Plays
items.summary: Morgan Stanley started coverage of Bitcoin miners like Cipher and TeraWulf with a positive outlook on their pivot to AI data centers, while rating Marathon Digital underweight due to Bitcoin volatility; shares of favored miners rose over 13% on Feb 10.[2]

items.title: Bitcoin Slides to $69,470 Extending Longest Losing Streak Since 2018
items.summary: Bitcoin continued its decline to around $69,470 after a slow week start, marking the longest losing streak since 2018 amid ongoing crypto winter, with mentions of U.S. regulatory advancements for stablecoins and digital assets.[3]

items.title: Bitcoin Breaks Below $69K Confirming Bearish Phase and Rebound Durability Concerns
items.summary: Bitcoin's drop under $69,000 signals a confirmed bear market phase, raising doubts about the sustainability of any recent rebounds.[4]

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Artmarket.com Reports Revenue Growth and Integrates Google Gemini 3 Pro Deep Think AI for Art Market Analysis
items.summary: Artmarket.com announced Q4 and annual revenue growth for 2025, highlighting integration of its proprietary Intuitive Artmarket® AI and use of Google Gemini 3 Ultra Mode Deep Think to audit its AI posture. The company emphasized tokenization of 18 million art works and benefits like zero latency and privacy for local AI processing in the art market.

items.title: AI Emerges as Elephant in the Newsroom, Prompting Journalist Reactions to Opportunities and Risks
items.summary: A Tyee explainer discusses how artificial intelligence is transforming newsrooms, presenting both opportunities and significant risks that journalists cannot ignore.

items.title: Anthropic and xAI Executives Disconnect from AI Ethical Concerns Amid Ongoing Advancements
items.summary: Leaders at Anthropic and xAI are reportedly stepping back from artificial intelligence ethical considerations as the technology continues to advance rapidly.

items.title: Zen-AI-Pentest Launched as Open-Source AI-Powered Penetration Testing Framework
items.summary: Zen-AI-Pentest is a new open-source framework that uses autonomous AI agents and security utilities for scanning and testing systems.

items.title: Canada Lags in Training Clinicians for AI Tools Already Deployed in Healthcare Clinics
items.summary: AI-powered tools are actively shaping clinical decisions across Canadian healthcare, but the country is failing to adequately train the professionals using them.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Sony Announces PlayStation State of Play for February 12, 2026
items.summary: Sony has scheduled a PlayStation State of Play presentation for Thursday, February 12, 2026, at 2:00 P.M. PT, featuring over 60 minutes of reveals, updates on games like Marvel’s Wolverine, Marathon, and more from third-parties, indies, and PlayStation Studios.

items.title: PS Plus Extra February 2026 Games Leaked Including Marvel’s Spider-Man 2
items.summary: Trusted leaker Billbil-kun has revealed three games joining the PS Plus Extra Game Catalog on February 17: Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 (PS5), Test Drive Unlimited Solar Crown (PS5), and Neva (PS5, PS4). The official announcement is expected soon, possibly during the State of Play.

items.title: Resident Evil 5 Remake Rumors Intensify with ESRB Listing
items.summary: Rumors of a Resident Evil 5 remake gain traction following a new ESRB rating listing, positioning it as a potential next major remake in the series.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Microsoft Patches 6 Actively Exploited Zero-Days in February 2026 Updates
items.summary: Microsoft's February 2026 Patch Tuesday addressed 60 vulnerabilities, including six zero-days actively exploited in the wild. The updates are critical for securing Windows systems against ongoing threats.

items.title: Microchip Technology Launches Production-Ready Edge Solutions for MCUs and MPUs
items.summary: Microchip rolled out full-stack edge solutions turning microcontrollers and microprocessors into real-time decisioning platforms. This expands markets in industrial and automotive edge computing.

items.title: Velo3D Qualifies as First Additive Manufacturing Vendor for U.S. Army Ground Vehicles
items.summary: Velo3D became the first qualified vendor for metal additive manufacturing in U.S. Army ground vehicles. This opens recurring revenue from military programs and validates the technology for high-value parts.

items.title: Mahindra Selects Mobileye’s SuperVision and ADAS for Next-Generation Models
items.summary: Mahindra chose Intel's Mobileye SuperVision and surround ADAS systems for upcoming vehicles. The deal supports growing adoption of Mobileye's sensor-software ecosystem among OEMs.

items.title: Microsoft Explores Superconducting Power Lines for More Energy-Efficient Data Centers
items.summary: Microsoft is investigating advanced superconducting power lines to boost data center efficiency. This could speed up its large-scale U.S. data center expansion amid rising energy demands.

items.title: UBS Turns Bearish on Tech Stocks Due to Big Tech Capex Plans
items.summary: UBS downgraded its technology sector forecast, citing heavy capital expenditure by major tech firms. Tech stocks were sidelined amid broader market gains on Nasdaq.
